programme.title: Her
Ona
programme.desc: Her: Directed by Spike Jonze. With Joaquin Phoenix, Lynn Adrianna Freedman, Lisa Renee Pitts, Gabe Gomez. In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1798709/","name":"Her","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1Nzk0OTM2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjU2NjEwMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1798709/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"generationfilm"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Her- Spike Jonze's Prophetic Reflection on Social Isolation and the Dependency on Evolving Technologies is as Sweet as it is Disconcerting","reviewBody":"At the heart of every truly great science-fiction film there is an emphasis on character that aims to reflect on some element of the human condition usually intended to open our minds to thought provoking predictions or eerily warn of an impending reality. We've seen numerous examples of these contemplative films throughout the very existence of cinema stemming all the way back to Fritz Lang's haunting futuristic piece Metropolis and has inspired countless others in its thoughtful wake as seen in memorable cinematic creations such as Ridley Scott's Blade Runner, Andrei Tarkovsky's Stalker, and even Duncan Jones' Moon. Never to be a director to back away from experimental presentation or psychological study, Spike Jonze's Her fully embraces this reflective science-fiction quality by peering into the deep sociable aspects of the human psyche giving us more of a prophetical reality than a fictional reflection. In his latest film Jonze creates a disconcerting yet equally endearing romance between a secluded depressive and his female operating system with an evolving consciousness, basically a HAL-9000 homage from Stanley Kubrick's 2001: A Space Odyssey, that brings to light a commentary on our dependency of programmed living and our need to maintain sociability when direct communication avenues have been stricken from life's normality. Rarely do ambitious films meet idyllically with their inquisitive potential, but Jonze has fashioned a delicately profound science-fiction contemplation that is depicted through the thoughtfulness of character alone that brims with wry humor, authentic pain, and charming revelation. Through the use of beautiful cinematography, impeccable production design, and subtle yet evocative performances, Her becomes a multilayered film experience where its character study of an isolated man afraid to become vulnerable again blends harmoniously with a truly unconventional yet naturally heartfelt romance. Jonze's affinity and ambition for presenting psychological challenges, as he has done before with Being John Malkovich, Adaptation, and especially in Where the Wild Things Are, finally collides with emotionally piercing conveyance within Her making it as thought provoking and as it is undeniably sweet. If the sole purpose of the science-fiction genre is to expound on societal, moral, and deeply psychological aspects of our human condition than Her fits soundly within that genre's capabilities by capturing our condition's essential need for sociability and love uncomfortably linking it with our antisocial dependency on technology.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":577129,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2014-01-10","keywords":"loneliness,romance with artificial intelligence,divorce,future,artificial intelligence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4112492569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI3ODI3Nzg3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY3NzQ3MDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI3ODI3Nzg3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY3NzQ3MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":" A lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with his newly purchased operating system that's designed to meet his every need. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001618/","name":"Joaquin Phoenix"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010736/","name":"Amy Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005069/","name":"Spike Jonze"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005069/","name":"Spike Jonze"}],"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

We've seen numerous examples of these contemplative films throughout the very existence of cinema stemming all the way back to Fritz Lang's haunting futuristic piece Metropolis and has inspired countless others in its thoughtful wake as seen in memorable cinematic creations such as Ridley Scott's Blade Runner, Andrei Tarkovsky's Stalker, and even Duncan Jones' Moon. Never to be a director to back away from experimental presentation or psychological study, Spike Jonze's Her fully embraces this reflective science-fiction quality by peering into the deep sociable aspects of the human psyche giving us more of a prophetical reality than a fictional reflection. In his latest film Jonze creates a disconcerting yet equally endearing romance between a secluded depressive and his female operating system with an evolving consciousness, basically a HAL-9000 homage from Stanley Kubrick's 2001: A Space Odyssey, that brings to light a commentary on our dependency of programmed living and our need to maintain sociability when direct communication avenues have been stricken from life's normality. Rarely do ambitious films meet idyllically with their inquisitive potential, but Jonze has fashioned a delicately profound science-fiction contemplation that is depicted through the thoughtfulness of character alone that brims with wry humor, authentic pain, and charming revelation. Through the use of beautiful cinematography, impeccable production design, and subtle yet evocative performances, Her becomes a multilayered film experience where its character study of an isolated man afraid to become vulnerable again blends harmoniously with a truly unconventional yet naturally heartfelt romance. Jonze's affinity and ambition for presenting psychological challenges, as he has done before with Being John Malkovich, Adaptation, and especially in Where the Wild Things Are, finally collides with emotionally piercing conveyance within Her making it as thought provoking and as it is undeniably sweet. If the sole purpose of the science-fiction genre is to expound on societal, moral, and deeply psychological aspects of our human condition than Her fits soundly within that genre's capabilities by capturing our condition's essential need for sociability and love uncomfortably linking it with our antisocial dependency on technology.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":577129,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2014-01-10","keywords":"loneliness,romance with artificial intelligence,divorce,future,artificial intelligence","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4112492569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI3ODI3Nzg3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY3NzQ3MDE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI3ODI3Nzg3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY3NzQ3MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":" A lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with his newly purchased operating system that's designed to meet his every need. ","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001618/","name":"Joaquin Phoenix","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010736/","name":"Amy Adams","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005069/","name":"Spike Jonze"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005069/","name":"Spike Jonze"],"duration":"PT2H6M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Every Day
Svakoga dana
programme.desc:
Every Day: Directed by Michael Sucsy. With Angourie Rice, Justice Smith, Jeni Ross, Lucas Jade Zumann. A shy teenager falls for a spirit who wakes up in the body of a different person every morning." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7026672/","name":"Every Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTFiNzQ2OGUtYTdmMi00NjRjLWExN2MtZmNiODI4MTY3MGM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4NTM5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A shy teenager falls for a spirit who wakes up in the body of a different person every morning.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7026672/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"js-66130"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"DAILY SCRUB","reviewBody":"Forget polygamy, hows about dating someone new every day? Well, the same someone who happens to inhabit a different skin upon waking. Great premise for a movie, so here we are.

"Every Day" is one of those giddy teen fantasies riding on a boffo, supernatural twist, that attempts to handle a crazy concept in a serious manner. And it kinda works. Works because the topics at hand - relationships, diversity and why we love - are universal enough to carry a twilight zone scenario.

What could have been a comedic mess, or a ridiculous sci-fi drama, instead turns out to be a charming, clever little film, delivering a table full of food for thought. Sure it gets a bit sappy at times, but the tissue industry needs the support.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20584,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-02-23","keywords":"singing in a car,mother daughter relationship,father daughter relationship,sister sister relationship,boyfriend girlfriend conflict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1251457049","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI5ZmQwZGItZmEwYy00ZThiLWJjOTgtM2MyZWM1NjEzMTc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI5ZmQwZGItZmEwYy00ZThiLWJjOTgtM2MyZWM1NjEzMTc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"16-year-old Rhiannon falls in love with a mysterious spirit named "A" who inhabits a different body every day. Feeling an unmatched connection, Rhiannon and A work each day to find each other, not knowing what or who the next day will bring. The more the two fall in love, the more the realities of loving someone who is a different person every 24 hours takes a toll, leaving Rhiannon and "A" to face the hardest decision either has ever had to make."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3886028/","name":"Angourie Rice"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6819854/","name":"Justice Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2913275/","name":"Debby Ryan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302591/","name":"Michael Sucsy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190175/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0470082/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296441/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5428959/","name":"Jesse Andrews"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2832819/","name":"David Levithan"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: True Lies
Istinite laži
programme.desc:
True Lies: Directed by James Cameron. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jamie Lee Curtis, Tom Arnold, Bill Paxton. A fearless, globe-trotting, terrorist-battling secret agent has his life turned upside down when he discovers his wife might be having an affair with a used-car salesman while terrorists smuggle nuclear war heads into the United States." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0111503/","name":"True Lies","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzg5YmUyNGMtMThiNS00MjA2LTgwZDctNDlhM2RkZDNmZmRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fearless, globe-trotting, terrorist-battling secret agent has his life turned upside down when he discovers his wife might be having an affair with a used-car salesman while terrorists smuggle nuclear war heads into the United Stat","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0111503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BroadswordCallinDannyBoy"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pure Arnie. Big, loud, and hilarious","reviewBody":"Once again, Arnie and Cameron team up to deliver a terrific action film.

Arnie stars as a secret agent posing as a computer salesman. Not even his wife knows his true identity and since he is always busy she decides to have a little excitement and hooks up with a nitwit posing as a secret agent! In the mean while, in trying to get her back, Arnie gets his family inadvertently pushed into a plot, by terrorists to nuke the USA! Preposterous? Yes! Hilarious? YES!!!

The resulting film has Arnie chasing motorcycles on horseback through hotels all the way to "borrowing" Harrier jets from the military. And, of course, getting his wife and daughter back.

Packed with awesome action scenes and some really terrific hilarious moments this is what an action movie should be. Not too serious and not too pointless. 8/10

programme.title: Zulu
Zulu
programme.desc:
Zulu: Directed by Cy Endfield. With Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, James Booth. Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058777/","name":"Zulu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlYmQ3MWMtMDY3My00MzVmLTg0YmMtYjRlZDUzNjBlMmE0L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058777/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Roosterbooster"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tribute to human courage.","reviewBody":"Zulu is the true story of the battle of Rourke's Drift between the British and Zulu nations in 1879. Both nations were aggressive, expansionist peoples. The British had pursued trade throughout the 18th and 19th centuries and suddenly found themselves in possession of an empire encompassing one quarter of the world. The Zulus, under the warrior-king Shaka Zulu, had become a society totally devoted to warfare and, with the possible exception of the Spartans over two thousand years before them, the most fearless soldiers the world had ever seen. It is important not to succumb to political correctness here, the Zulus had ruthlessly oppressed other nations in black Africa and caused mass migrations of people, the effects of which are felt to this day. The British meanwhile, had provoked a confrontation with them and suffered a defeat at Isandlwana where modern weapons has proved insufficient against overwhelming numbers of incredibly brave and disciplined warriors. The day after the battle the small British garrison at Rourke's Drift seemed doomed. Just over 100 men plus sick men in the hospital faced thousands of Zulus eager for their share of the glory which their brothers had won at Isandlwana.

The nature of the British Army at this time was not promising. Before Waterloo in 1815 the Duke of Wellington had described them as "the scum of the earth" - rogues, ne'er-do-wells, criminals, drunkards, ladanum fiends, debtors fresh from prison, even lunatics. In 1879 they were not much different. They were incredibly badly paid, their conditions of service were atrocious, they were despised by the civilians, led by officers who often owed their position to aristocratic privilege and money. Sometimes they were booed in the street and refused access to pubs and music halls such was their lowly status. And yet, and yet... they had faced and defeated some of the most fearsome warriors on Earth. The Pathans, Burmese, Afghans, Sudanese "Fuzzy-Wuzzies" as well as Napoleon's invincible Imperial Guard. If they survived the bloody colonial wars they could expect an early death in the work-house, unappreciated by the people whose incomes they had guarded. If you are interested in the Victorian soldiers see Kipling's poems (especially "Tommy Atkins") or read George Orwell's long essay on Kipling or "The Lion And The Unicorn".

This film salutes human beings in extremis. Though told from the British viewpoint it pays handsome tribute to the magnificent courage and honour of the Zulu warriors as well as the British soldiers wondering "what are we doing here?". The best perfomances in the film, in my opinion, are from James Booth as Private Hook, the cynical drunkard turned reluctant hero and Nigel Green as the awesome Colour-Sergeant Bourne. It portrays courage and stoicism which modern people seem to lack; heroism when all seems lost, faith in the regiment and your mates and old-fashioned manliness."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0058777, Title: Zulu, --- Description: Zulu: Directed by Cy Endfield. With Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, James Booth. Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058777/","name":"Zulu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlYmQ3MWMtMDY3My00MzVmLTg0YmMtYjRlZDUzNjBlMmE0L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058777/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Roosterbooster","dateCreated":"2001-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tribute to human courage.","reviewBody":"Zulu is the true story of the battle of Rourke's Drift between the British and Zulu nations in 1879. Both nations were aggressive, expansionist peoples. The British had pursued trade throughout the 18th and 19th centuries and suddenly found themselves in possession of an empire encompassing one quarter of the world. The Zulus, under the warrior-king Shaka Zulu, had become a society totally devoted to warfare and, with the possible exception of the Spartans over two thousand years before them, the most fearless soldiers the world had ever seen. It is important not to succumb to political correctness here, the Zulus had ruthlessly oppressed other nations in black Africa and caused mass migrations of people, the effects of which are felt to this day. The British meanwhile, had provoked a confrontation with them and suffered a defeat at Isandlwana where modern weapons has proved insufficient against overwhelming numbers of incredibly brave and disciplined warriors. The day after the battle the small British garrison at Rourke's Drift seemed doomed. Just over 100 men plus sick men in the hospital faced thousands of Zulus eager for their share of the glory which their brothers had won at Isandlwana.

The nature of the British Army at this time was not promising. Before Waterloo in 1815 the Duke of Wellington had described them as "the scum of the earth" - rogues, ne'er-do-wells, criminals, drunkards, ladanum fiends, debtors fresh from prison, even lunatics. In 1879 they were not much different. They were incredibly badly paid, their conditions of service were atrocious, they were despised by the civilians, led by officers who often owed their position to aristocratic privilege and money. Sometimes they were booed in the street and refused access to pubs and music halls such was their lowly status. And yet, and yet... they had faced and defeated some of the most fearsome warriors on Earth. The Pathans, Burmese, Afghans, Sudanese "Fuzzy-Wuzzies" as well as Napoleon's invincible Imperial Guard. If they survived the bloody colonial wars they could expect an early death in the work-house, unappreciated by the people whose incomes they had guarded. If you are interested in the Victorian soldiers see Kipling's poems (especially "Tommy Atkins") or read George Orwell's long essay on Kipling or "The Lion And The Unicorn".

This film salutes human beings in extremis. Though told from the British viewpoint it pays handsome tribute to the magnificent courage and honour of the Zulu warriors as well as the British soldiers wondering "what are we doing here?". The best perfomances in the film, in my opinion, are from James Booth as Private Hook, the cynical drunkard turned reluctant hero and Nigel Green as the awesome Colour-Sergeant Bourne. It portrays courage and stoicism which modern people seem to lack; heroism when all seems lost, faith in the regiment and your mates and old-fashioned manliness.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"],"duration":"PT2H18M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Madame Bovary
Gospođa Bovary
programme.desc:
Madame Bovary: Directed by Claude Chabrol. With Isabelle Huppert, Jean-François Balmer, Christophe Malavoy, Jean Yanne. In nineteenth-century France, the romantic daughter of a country squire marries a dull country doctor. To escape boredom, she throws herself into love affairs with a suave local landowner and a law student, and runs up ruinous debts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0102368/","name":"Madame Bovary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDY3YjIyMDItMWNlMS00ZDIzLWJhMDUtN2NlOTNjMmI3MGUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzUyOTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In nineteenth-century France, the romantic daughter of a country squire marries a dull country doctor. To escape boredom, she throws herself into love affairs with a suave local landowner and a law student, and runs up ruinous debts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0102368/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2007-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"the film Flaubert would have made from his novel","reviewBody":"This was Claude Chabrol's intention and it's easier to say than to do. Gustave Flaubert's novel was so rich, undulating that any adaptation in images can only be reducing and simplistic. More than the tragic story of its heroine, Flaubert's novel encompassed a word picture of Normandy (the bulk of the film was shot in the village of Lyons-La-Forêt near Rouen) and a cruel, cynical vision of the world. If the first feature is satisfying on the screen, the second one is hardly perceptible. Hence, this crucial question: is it possible to fully recreate Flaubert's novel? Chabrol's film is faithful to the main plot with the rise and fall of her heroine sometimes told by François Périer's voice-over in spite of accelerated views on certain vital episodes, notably the peasant marriage that disgusted Emma Bovary. On the other hand, the crest of the novel (the ball to the marquis) found a perfect equivalent in Chabrol's film with this shot which goes through the turning dresses creating thus a whirlpool. The glittering life Emma dreams of instead of a dull one with her mediocre husband Charles.

Chabrol is buoyed by topnotch interpretations. Even if Isabelle Huppert is a convincing Emma Bovary, a woman whose messy dreams and follies badly conceal boredom and disgust of her condition, the other main actors steal the show with Jean-François Balmer as the perfect, narrow-minded Charles Bovary, Christophe Malavoy as unfaithful Rodolphe Boulanger and Jean Yanne as the unscrupulous chemist Homais.

"Madame Bovary" is aesthetically a refined work with lush scenery and lavish costumes that recreate rural life in Normandy in the middle of the nineteenth Century. But Chabrol doesn't break new ground with this adaptation that required something else than an elegant directing, a brilliant cast and splendid scenery. That's why his rendering of Flaubert's work is just an honorable reading of the novel in the end. One could also add that Flaubert's book was a solid opportunity for an onslaught at provincial lower middle class. But it's only skimmed over and it's a wasted bonanza.

Chabrol's reading of "Madame Bovary" amounts to the same result as Claude Berri's adaptation of Emile Zola's epic novel "Germinal" in 1993: honorable instead of being unforgettable, a commendable action instead of a ground-breaking creation. The author of "le Boucher" (1970) was rather on the wrong track but fortunately, he'll find his way again the following year with another woman depiction: "Betty" (1992). Georges Simenon's universe suits him much better than Flaubert's one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3885,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1991-04-03","keywords":"character name as title,emma bovary character,period drama,quoting alphonse de lamartine,wedding","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Madame Bovary (1991)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3198616345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmY4NDQ3ZjItNDY2OC00NWM5LTg4ZDMtZDczNmIxNWJlZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmY4NDQ3ZjItNDY2OC00NWM5LTg4ZDMtZDczNmIxNWJlZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Samuel Goldwyn"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050983/","name":"Jean-François Balmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539022/","name":"Christophe Malavoy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001031/","name":"Claude Chabrol"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022545/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055736/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254873/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281306/","name":"Gustave Flaubert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001031/","name":"Claude Chabrol"}],"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Werk ohne Autor
Djelo bez autora
programme.desc:
Werk ohne Autor: Directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. With Tom Schilling, Sebastian Koch, Paula Beer, Saskia Rosendahl. German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5311542/","name":"Werk ohne Autor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGE2ZmVhOGUtOWE4Ni00MDZiLWJkMTktOWI5ZWU0ZDk1NGViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzI1NzMxNzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5311542/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chong_an"},"dateCreated":"2018-09-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"What is truth in art?","reviewBody":"Inspired by the life of one artist and stories by others, this tale of fiction asks artists what is their truth, and how they are able to reveal it. Along the way, it shows how Nazi and Soviet art have strong similarities in their realisms, while modern art can be conceptual jokes.

The humans are 2 families who, if they knew, were on opposite sides during the Nazi era. The artist / husband's father suffered both ways as joining the Nazis too late, while his beloved aunt was sent away by his father-in-law, eventually to the gas chambers. But the father-in-law spends his post-war life in fear of Nazi hunters, even as he hides in plain sight.

Featuring a strong cast and realistic sets, this is a strong movie. Still, from the director's Q+A from the Toronto International Film Festival, the idea of subjective truth that also infuses the film can be a distraction.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19597,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-10-03","keywords":"east germany,painter,doctor,forced abortion,pregnancy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1224587801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Never Look Away' follows thirty years in the life of artist Kurt Barnert (a character loosely based on Gerhard Richter). From a childhood witnessing Nazi Germany to life in post-war East Berlin."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462407/","name":"Sebastian Koch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3559009/","name":"Paula Beer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0569143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0128215/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"duration":"PT3H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zulu
Zulu
programme.desc:
Zulu: Directed by Cy Endfield. With Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, James Booth. Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058777/","name":"Zulu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlYmQ3MWMtMDY3My00MzVmLTg0YmMtYjRlZDUzNjBlMmE0L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058777/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Roosterbooster"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tribute to human courage.","reviewBody":"Zulu is the true story of the battle of Rourke's Drift between the British and Zulu nations in 1879. Both nations were aggressive, expansionist peoples. The British had pursued trade throughout the 18th and 19th centuries and suddenly found themselves in possession of an empire encompassing one quarter of the world. The Zulus, under the warrior-king Shaka Zulu, had become a society totally devoted to warfare and, with the possible exception of the Spartans over two thousand years before them, the most fearless soldiers the world had ever seen. It is important not to succumb to political correctness here, the Zulus had ruthlessly oppressed other nations in black Africa and caused mass migrations of people, the effects of which are felt to this day. The British meanwhile, had provoked a confrontation with them and suffered a defeat at Isandlwana where modern weapons has proved insufficient against overwhelming numbers of incredibly brave and disciplined warriors. The day after the battle the small British garrison at Rourke's Drift seemed doomed. Just over 100 men plus sick men in the hospital faced thousands of Zulus eager for their share of the glory which their brothers had won at Isandlwana.

The nature of the British Army at this time was not promising. Before Waterloo in 1815 the Duke of Wellington had described them as "the scum of the earth" - rogues, ne'er-do-wells, criminals, drunkards, ladanum fiends, debtors fresh from prison, even lunatics. In 1879 they were not much different. They were incredibly badly paid, their conditions of service were atrocious, they were despised by the civilians, led by officers who often owed their position to aristocratic privilege and money. Sometimes they were booed in the street and refused access to pubs and music halls such was their lowly status. And yet, and yet... they had faced and defeated some of the most fearsome warriors on Earth. The Pathans, Burmese, Afghans, Sudanese "Fuzzy-Wuzzies" as well as Napoleon's invincible Imperial Guard. If they survived the bloody colonial wars they could expect an early death in the work-house, unappreciated by the people whose incomes they had guarded. If you are interested in the Victorian soldiers see Kipling's poems (especially "Tommy Atkins") or read George Orwell's long essay on Kipling or "The Lion And The Unicorn".

This film salutes human beings in extremis. Though told from the British viewpoint it pays handsome tribute to the magnificent courage and honour of the Zulu warriors as well as the British soldiers wondering "what are we doing here?". The best perfomances in the film, in my opinion, are from James Booth as Private Hook, the cynical drunkard turned reluctant hero and Nigel Green as the awesome Colour-Sergeant Bourne. It portrays courage and stoicism which modern people seem to lack; heroism when all seems lost, faith in the regiment and your mates and old-fashioned manliness."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

Titanic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120338/","name":"Titanic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdmZGU3NDQtY2E5My00ZTliLWIzOTUtMTY4ZGI1YjdiNjk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA4NzY1MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120338/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"beaumisebastian"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"James Cameron's Titanic is a masterpiece and a tour de force of filmmaking","reviewBody":"Titanic is world famous. The film that broke every box office record on release and wore the box office champion crown for many years(until it was overtaken by Jim Cameron's Avatar) is special because not only does it showcase the Titanic disaster in all its glory the film is a technical achievement of the highest order. The sinking sequence is astonishing and it feels like you are watching the actual ship sink. The characters and actors are amazing and even with a large running length you never dare look at the watch. James Cameron is a master director and Titanic is his stamp of authority."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1109625,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"keywords":"iceberg,sailor's death,love affair,sunken ship,mass death","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"3D Release","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi907189785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzczNjA2MTY5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTgyNDY2NzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzczNjA2MTY5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTgyNDY2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the new trailer for James Cameron's Academy Award winning blockbuster, coming to theaters in 3D. programme.desc: The Craft: Legacy: Directed by Zoe Lister-Jones. With Cailee Spaeny, Zoey Luna, Gideon Adlon, Lovie Simone. A group of high school students form a coven of witches." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4685762/","name":"The Craft: Legacy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY0YzYwM2YtMzcyOC00YmFjLTgxMzEtNzg0YjEwYjlhY2I5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of high school students form a coven of witches.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4685762/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lewismusgrove88"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Disappointing","reviewBody":"The movie was much more tender, drama like and "woke" than I cared for to be honest. There was literally zero character build-up and whilst the acting was good, the storyline was pretty basic overall. I would've liked a darker tone with another nutter (Nancy style) who takes stuff too far and walks on water so I was kinda disappointed with this high school TV movie offering. programme.title: The Good Liar
Savršena laž
programme.desc:
The Good Liar: Directed by Bill Condon. With Helen Mirren, Ian McKellen, Russell Tovey, Jim Carter. Consummate con man Roy Courtnay has set his sights on his latest mark: the recently widowed Betty McLeish, worth millions. But this time, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with the ultimate stakes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5563334/","name":"The Good Liar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhNTY5ZTUtYzc1NC00NjUyLWI1NDQtYWE3YmJlNjQ3OGVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Consummate con man Roy Courtnay has set his sights on his latest mark: the recently widowed Betty McLeish, worth millions. But this time, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with the ultimate st","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5563334/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tm-sheehan"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Masterclass in Great Acting","reviewBody":"My Review : The Good Liar my rating 8.5

No Spoilers as usual from me except to say the trailers of The Good Liar give us only an inkling into the complex maze the plot reveals and that it's a master class in great acting from Sir Ian McKellen and Dame Helen Mirren.

I think it's the finest performance from Ian McKellen since his Oscar nominated role in Gods and Monsters in 1999 and I'm not surprised that Bill Condon the director of this film also directed Ian McKellen in Gods and Monsters.

In The Good Liar Ian McKellen is cast as Roy Courtnay who meets Helen Mirren cast as Betty McLeish on a mature age dating site it soon becomes apparently clear that Roy's motives are not honourable in any way shape or form it takes us a lot longer to reveal Betty's true motive. In the meantime we meet Betty's hunky handsome protective Grandson Stephen perfectly played by Russell Tovey who seeks out to find out all he can about his Grandmother's new border and boyfriend.

Jim Carter who plays Mr Carson in Downton Abbey is very impressive in the very different role of Vincent the best friend of Roy Courtney and "business associate " it's a great ensemble cast and this film has some great plot twisters and surprises that at times may seem a little improbable but that didn't bother me a bit.

It's the performances of McKellen and Mirren that are sublime, subtle and mesmerising the range of these two actors is astonishing when you think back to characters like Helen Mirren in The Queen or Catherine the Great and Maria Altman in Woman in Gold then Ian McKellen as Gandalf or James Whale in Gods and Monsters and King Lear to see them together in a film for the first time ,they have appeared on stage together in 2001 in Dance of Death on Broadway.

I must mention the great score by Carter Burwell it's perfect and gives great atmosphere to the emotional and suspenseful plot I really like his scores and this is up with his previous film scores for Carol, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing ,Missouri and In Bruges.

I really enjoyed The Good Liar go see it and don't let anyone tell you the outcome of this complex story.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36833,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-11-08","keywords":"con artist,elderly gigolo,past coming back to haunt,online dating,flashback","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1183235865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA1MzY0NzMtYTM1ZS00YTZiLTk3MWItMjlmZDVhYTQyMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA1MzY0NzMtYTM1ZS00YTZiLTk3MWItMjlmZDVhYTQyMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005212/","name":"Ian McKellen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869871/","name":"Russell Tovey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174374/","name":"Bill Condon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465018/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8006852/","name":"Nicholas Searle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0368774/","name":"Jeffrey Hatcher"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Minyan
Minjan
programme.desc:
Minyan: Directed by Eric Steel. With Samuel H. Levine, Ron Rifkin, Christopher McCann, Mark Margolis. A young Jewish man is caught between thrilling private trysts and his repressive family in this thoughtful drama set in 1980s Brooklyn." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10268550/","name":"Minyan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA3NGFhMGMtNzYzYy00NTM5LTkzMWMtMmUyMDZlNTdlMGVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMyMzI4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Jewish man is caught between thrilling private trysts and his repressive family in this thoughtful drama set in 1980s Brooklyn.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10268550/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ten men are needed for a minyan","reviewBody":"Minyan (2020) was co-written and directed by Eric Steel. It stars Samuel H. Levine as David, a young yeshiva student, who has to come to grips with the fact that he is gay, and the fact that he is not certain that he believes in God.

Sadly, coming out as gay in a traditional family is a problem for many people. The centrality of this problem is reflected in the number of movies about gays coming out. What makes this movie different is the superb acting, and the uncanny rendering of Orthodox Jewish life in Brooklyn in the 1980's.

A minyan is ten men (or ten people) that are required for a full Jewish prayer service. As do people in other religions, Jews pray all the time. But it requires a minyan to bring out the Torah. Part of the plot depends upon the fact that David and his father can make a minyan where they live.

We saw this film as part of Image Out, the excellent Rochester LGBT Film Festival. This isn't a great movie, but I think it's worth seeing. The film has an anemic IMDb rating of 6.7. I thought it was better than that and rated it 8.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":463,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-10-29","keywords":"male nudity,male rear nudity,gay sex,gay interest,jewish","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3601580825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmRkODkxODItNDU3MC00MzgxLWEwOWEtYjI3ZDU1ZjJkOTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmRkODkxODItNDU3MC00MzgxLWEwOWEtYjI3ZDU1ZjJkOTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Jewish man is caught between thrilling private trysts and his repressive family in this thoughtful drama set in 1980s Brooklyn."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6024011/","name":"Samuel H. Titanic

A group of high school students form a coven of witches." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4685762/","name":"The Craft: Legacy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY0YzYwM2YtMzcyOC00YmFjLTgxMzEtNzg0YjEwYjlhY2I5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of high school students form a coven of witches.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4685762/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lewismusgrove88"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Disappointing","reviewBody":"The movie was much more tender, drama like and "woke" than I cared for to be honest. There was literally zero character build-up and whilst the acting was good, the storyline was pretty basic overall. I would've liked a darker tone with another nutter (Nancy style) who takes stuff too far and walks on water so I was kinda disappointed with this high school TV movie offering. programme.desc:
Run: Directed by Aneesh Chaganty. With Sarah Paulson, Kiera Allen, Sara Sohn, Pat Healy. A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8633478/","name":"Run","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjdmZDlkMzItNTg0OS00MjAxLWE0ZTQtZjdhOWM1MTJkOTc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8633478/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Neon_Gold"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really Fun and Well Made","reviewBody":"This was such a good thriller. I think it was one of the most effective ones that i have seen this year.

It was defiantly a fun, hour and a half popcorn fun movie but i think it was just that little bit extra too. The filmmaking was above that for me. It just had that little bit of extra care put into it and i think it made all the difference.

The acting was really great from both of the leads. I was really impressed with Kiera Allen. This was her debut film and i think this will net her even more roles because she was fantastic.

I found the score really great too. It really worked together with the script and filmmaking to really get you into the film. I appreciated it.

You should definitely watch this, its really fun, supper quick and well made.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":62933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-11-20","keywords":"revenge,kidnapping,villainess played by lead actress,mother daughter relationship,child abduction","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1238024473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EwOWRkMjAtNmRiOS00MTY5LTgxZmMtNDc5OGM4MDVhYmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EwOWRkMjAtNmRiOS00MTY5LTgxZmMtNDc5OGM4MDVhYmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005299/","name":"Sarah Paulson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6266674/","name":"Kiera Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3337639/","name":"Sara Sohn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3792134/","name":"Aneesh Chaganty"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3792134/","name":"Aneesh Chaganty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3539578/","name":"Sev Ohanian"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

I think it was one of the most effective ones that i have seen this year.

It was defiantly a fun, hour and a half popcorn fun movie but i think it was just that little bit extra too. The filmmaking was above that for me. It just had that little bit of extra care put into it and i think it made all the difference.

The acting was really great from both of the leads. I was really impressed with Kiera Allen. This was her debut film and i think this will net her even more roles because she was fantastic.

I found the score really great too. It really worked together with the script and filmmaking to really get you into the film. I appreciated it.

programme.title: Dr. Blake
programme.desc: Ova serija vodi nas u australsku provinciju pedesetih godina prošlog stoljeća, gdje se doktor-forenzičar Lucien Blake protivi strogim društvenim pravilima. Ova serija vodi nas u australsku provinciju pedesetih godina prošlog stoljeća, gdje se doktor-forenzičar Lucien Blake protivi strogim društvenim pravilima. Dok rješava zločine, dr. Blake sluša tajne i laži svojih pacijenata i pomaže im da unesu mir i pravdu u svoje živote. Blake je obrazovan, proputovao je svijet i vidio najgore što ljudi mogu učiniti jedni drugima. Nakon studija u Škotskoj, dr. Blake je kao vojni ljekar u britanskoj vojsci služio na Dalekom istoku tokom Drugoga svjetskog rata. Bez znanja porodice oženio se Kineskinjom s kojom je dobio dijete. U doba pada Singapura izgubili su kontakt. Na kraju duge i neuspješne potrage za suprugom i djetetom, dr. Blake se vraća u rodni Ballarat, kako bi preuzeo praksu od svog oca na samrti. Progone ga uspomene na ratne užase, zatočeništvo u zloglasnom logoru u Tajlandu i njegov lični gubitak. U javnosti dr. Blake je moralni kompas zajednice, dok je privatno čovjek koji iz prve ruke zna kako ljudi mogu biti nečovječni prema drugima. Rijetki razumiju njegov vragolasti humor i mogu probiti njegov psihološki oklop. Čak ni njegova odana asistentica Jean ponekad nema strpljenja za Dr. Blakea.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Očajni otac kojeg je policija ignorirala otima milijarderovu kći te se s njom do povratka svog nestalog djeteta zaključava u gotovo neprobojnu sigurnu sobu. Jubal provjerava svoju vještinu... Očajni otac kojeg je policija ignorirala otima milijarderovu kći te se s njom do povratka svog nestalog djeteta zaključava u gotovo neprobojnu sigurnu sobu. Jubal provjerava svoju vještinu pregovaranja u talačkoj situaciji.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Kada ekipu pozovu na mjesto ubojstva, brzo posumnjaju na politički motiv, ali kad se dogodi još jedno umorstvo, počnu raditi kako bi našli zajedničku nit koja ih povezuje kako se ne bi nagomilalo još... Kada ekipu pozovu na mjesto ubojstva, brzo posumnjaju na politički motiv, ali kad se dogodi još jedno umorstvo, počnu raditi kako bi našli zajedničku nit koja ih povezuje kako se ne bi nagomilalo još leševa. Maggie razmišlja o odluci koja bi joj utjecala na karijeru.

programme.title: Cherif
programme.desc: Dan Deborinog vjenčanja! Ali zabava se otkazuje vrlo brzo jer sav policijski tim prima poruku s fotografijom nepoznate žene. Imaju četiri sata da zaustave njenog ubojicu. Zajedno rješavaju zločine, ali… S jedne strane, tu je Kader Sharif, detektiv za ubojstva koji živi za svoj posao i ima nekonvencionalan pristup. S druge strane, tu je njegova nova partnerica, Adeline Briard, koja više voli igrati po pravilima.

programme.desc:
Blue Bloods: Created by Mitchell Burgess, Robin Green. With Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou. Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SomeBlueDevil"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most hypocritical show out there","reviewBody":"I started watching this on ION a while back simply because there wasn't anything else on. I figured it has Tom Selleck in it, so it might be alright.

Just a few episodes in I had to change the channel. It's a bit like watching FOX News. If that's your channel, you'll LOVE this show and downvote my review. LOL Otherwise, you will find it hypocritical: a show with an emphasis on being overly religious but not having the morals to go along with that mindset.

programme.title: Američki gradovi zločina
programme.desc: Na zabačenoj lokalnoj cesti pronađu povučenu, mladu učiteljicu nasmrt izbodenu. Istražitelje pritišću da pronađu bilo koga s motivom da joj naudi. Ali u gradiću Burleyu, Idaho, kreću šaputanja…. Na zabačenoj lokalnoj cesti pronađu povučenu, mladu učiteljicu nasmrt izbodenu. Istražitelje pritišću da pronađu bilo koga s motivom da joj naudi. Ali u gradiću Burleyu, Idaho, kreću šaputanja….

programme.title: Navy CIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS-ov tim dobiva rok od 22 sata nakon što istraga ubojstva glavnog nalogodavca koji se specijalizirao za kontraobavještajne podatke otkriva da je njegova supruga oteta i da je zadržan zbog... NCIS-ov tim dobiva rok od 22 sata nakon što istraga ubojstva glavnog nalogodavca koji se specijalizirao za kontraobavještajne podatke otkriva da je njegova supruga oteta i da je zadržan zbog otkupnine.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Očajni otac kojeg je policija ignorirala otima milijarderovu kći te se s njom do povratka svog nestalog djeteta zaključava u gotovo neprobojnu sigurnu sobu. Jubal provjerava svoju vještinu... Očajni otac kojeg je policija ignorirala otima milijarderovu kći te se s njom do povratka svog nestalog djeteta zaključava u gotovo neprobojnu sigurnu sobu. Jubal provjerava svoju vještinu pregovaranja u talačkoj situaciji.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Kada ekipu pozovu na mjesto ubojstva, brzo posumnjaju na politički motiv, ali kad se dogodi još jedno umorstvo, počnu raditi kako bi našli zajedničku nit koja ih povezuje kako se ne bi nagomilalo još... Kada ekipu pozovu na mjesto ubojstva, brzo posumnjaju na politički motiv, ali kad se dogodi još jedno umorstvo, počnu raditi kako bi našli zajedničku nit koja ih povezuje kako se ne bi nagomilalo još leševa. Maggie razmišlja o odluci koja bi joj utjecala na karijeru.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Jess LaCroix i ekipa pomažu u potjeri za bjeguncem kojeg je LaCroix uhitio prije više godina. Nestao je autobus s 26 učenika, a njihov je bjegunac glavni osumnjičenik. Jess LaCroix i ekipa pomažu u potjeri za bjeguncem kojeg je LaCroix uhitio prije više godina. Nestao je autobus s 26 učenika, a njihov je bjegunac glavni osumnjičenik.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Od dobitnika nagrade Emmy Dicka Wolfa i ekipe koji stoji iza franšize "Zakon i red", FBI je napeta drama o unutarnjem radu Federalnog istražnog ureda u New Yorku. Nakon pronalaska tijela studenta, ekipa FBI-ja istražuje prodaju droge koja je pošla po zlu. Istražiteljica Hailey Upton privremeno se priključuje ekipi, no njezine su tradicionalne istražne metode u opreci s FBI-jevim formalnijim okruženjem.

programme.title: Cherif
programme.desc: Sharif se svađa sa svojom kćeri koja ima priliku otputovati na godinu dana u SAD, dok s Briardom istražuje smrt mehaničara. Zajedno rješavaju zločine, ali… S jedne strane, tu je Kader Sharif, detektiv za ubojstva koji živi za svoj posao i ima nekonvencionalan pristup. S druge strane, tu je njegova nova partnerica, Adeline Briard, koja više voli igrati po pravilima.

programme.title: Američki gradovi zločina
programme.desc: U gradiću Portsmouth, Ohio, nestala je baka od 72 godine. Policija ima samo zagonetne i zloslutne ključeve o tome što se moglo dogoditi. Prijatelji i obitelj nestale nemaju pojma kamo je mogla otići.... U gradiću Portsmouth, Ohio, nestala je baka od 72 godine. Policija ima samo zagonetne i zloslutne ključeve o tome što se moglo dogoditi. Prijatelji i obitelj nestale nemaju pojma kamo je mogla otići. Nitko od susjeda nije zapazio ništa neobično.

credits.actor: Toby Jones, Andrea Riseborough, Kim Cattrall, David Haig, Billy Howle, Monica Dolan, Miranda Nolan, Paul Dallison

programme.title: Zločinački umovi
programme.desc: Jedinica za bihevioralnu analizu prati rastrojenog ubojicu u Virginiji koji osjeća grizodušje zbog počinjenih zločina. Jedinica za bihevioralnu analizu prati rastrojenog ubojicu u Virginiji koji osjeća grizodušje zbog počinjenih zločina.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Jess LaCroix i ekipa pomažu u potjeri za bjeguncem kojeg je LaCroix uhitio prije više godina. Nestao je autobus s 26 učenika, a njihov je bjegunac glavni osumnjičenik. Jess LaCroix i ekipa pomažu u potjeri za bjeguncem kojeg je LaCroix uhitio prije više godina. Nestao je autobus s 26 učenika, a njihov je bjegunac glavni osumnjičenik.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Od dobitnika nagrade Emmy Dicka Wolfa i ekipe koji stoji iza franšize "Zakon i red", FBI je napeta drama o unutarnjem radu Federalnog istražnog ureda u New Yorku. Nakon pronalaska tijela studenta, ekipa FBI-ja istražuje prodaju droge koja je pošla po zlu. Istražiteljica Hailey Upton privremeno se priključuje ekipi, no njezine su tradicionalne istražne metode u opreci s FBI-jevim formalnijim okruženjem.

credits.actor: John Nettles, Jason Hughes, Jane Wymark, Barry Jackson, Kirsty Dillon, David Ryall, Margaret Tyzack, Caroline Blakiston

programme.title: Cherif
programme.desc: Na Sharifa utječe predviđanje, da će prije kraja dana možda umrijeti. Zajedno rješavaju zločine, ali… S jedne strane, tu je Kader Sharif, detektiv za ubojstva koji živi za svoj posao i ima nekonvencionalan pristup. S druge strane, tu je njegova nova partnerica, Adeline Briard, koja više voli igrati po pravilima.

programme.title: Kosti
programme.desc: Ova serija u 12 epizoda približit će priče o Brennan, Boothu i Jeffersonian-FBI ekipi, omogućujući vjernim fanovima emisije da se oproste od ovih nezaboravnih likova. Glavni likovi ove mračno zabavne proceduralne drame su usko specijalizirana forenzična antropologinja dr. Brennan i agent FBI-a Seeley Booth. Oni surađuju u istragama ubojstava u kojima su standardne metode identifikacije tijela beskorisne.

Dečki možda ne pogode svaki put, ali obično se zabave.

programme.title: Teorija velikog praska
programme.desc: Leonard (Johnny Galecki) i Sheldon (Jim Parsons) mogu vam ispričati sve što vas zanima o kvantnoj fizici, no rješavanje najjednostavnijih stvari iz svakodnevnog života potpuna im je zagonetka. Oni su bez sumnje genijalni, no zašto im je onda tako teško prići ljepšem spolu? Uz pomoć Kaley Cuoco, prijatelji će naučiti najvažniju životnu lekciju!Leonard (Johnny Galecki) i Sheldon (Jim Parsons) mogu vam ispričati sve što vas zanima o kvantnoj fizici, no rješavanje najjednostavnijih stvari iz svakodnevnog života potpuna je zagonetka dvojici prijatelja. Oni su briljantni fizičari koji mogu shvatiti kako svemir funkcionira, no kako komunicirati s ljudima, osobito djevojkama, potpuni im je misterij. To se počinje mijenjati kada se Penny (Kaley Cuoco) doseli u njihovo susjedstvo. I dok je Sheldon sretan sa svojim disfunkcionalnim prijateljima Wolowitzom (Simon Helberg) i Koothrappalijem (Kunal Nayyar), Leonard u Penny vidi šansu za romansom.

credits.actor: Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco, Simon Helberg, Kunal Nayyar, Mayim Bialik, Melissa Rauch

programme.title: Malcolm u sredini
programme.desc: Malcolm, srednje dijete s genijalnim kvocijentom inteligencije, suočava se s borbama i izazovima svakodnevnog života, zajedno sa svojom disfunkcionalnom obitelji. Malcolm ne želi da ga doživljavaju kao štrebera, ali Lois ga posrami u školi. Reese maltretira druge, čak se potuče s kozom u zoološkom vrtu. Francis se suočava sa zlim kravama na farmi. Dewey nastupi u predstavi na koju njegova obitelj ne dođe.

programme.title: Castle
Castle
programme.desc:
Castle: Created by Andrew W. Marlowe. With Nathan Fillion, Stana Katic, Susan Sullivan, Jon Huertas. After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1219024/","name":"Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM2NjU0ODU0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAwMzg5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1219024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cchase"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fillion is "King" Of This CASTLE...","reviewBody":"Oh, yeah, we've seen this one before....Irresistible-force-meets-immovable object. Opposites attract. Oil and water. Fire and ice...you know the drill. The problem is that when you have a pairing that mixes snappy patter and grudgingly mutual admiration with just a touch of sexual tension, the recipe is only going to be as good as the charisma of the two leads involved, whether it's a sitcom, dramedy or police procedural. 

CASTLE wants to be a mix of all three, and fortunately one of the most valuable weapons in its arsenal is the rakish charm of its featured lead actor, former FIREFLY star Nathan Fillion. I can count the number of actors on one hand who can pull off the "charming rascal" vibe in a way that never gets old, and Nathan can do those guys in his sleep. (And probably has.)

But he also knows how to modulate them as the occasion warrants, and where in his former role as Captain Mal Reynolds he could definitely play the bad-ass card when needed, here as womanizing bad-boy, party animal and bestselling novelist Rick Castle, he's a whole lot less serious. Bored with the cop character who has been his bread-and-butter for a string of chart-busting crime thrillers, Rick has decided in his latest tome to blow his hero's brains out, thus making a continuance of the series a little difficult to say the least. It wouldn't be a problem if the laid-back Lothario weren't suddenly faced with a major case of writer's block. But inspiration is coming in the most fortuitous if unlikely of ways. 

A serial killer has decided to rehash some of the more gruesome deaths from Castle's earlier novels, and it's up to the very attractive (of course!) and no-nonsense detective Kate Beckett (newcomer Stana Katic) to crack the case...which of course will require the assistance of a certain writer of whose books Detective Beckett is a closet fan. But a fan of smart-alecky guys who like to make very unsubtle passes at her? Not so much. Let the games and one-upmanship begin!

At first blush, you could easily accuse CASTLE of trying too hard, especially since matched with the seasoned experience of Fillion, the jury was out on Katic's ability to keep up with him in the first few episodes (at least it was for me.) And to enhance its credibility, the pilot even threw in some heavy hitters in guest cameos - James Patterson, no stranger himself to the crime fiction genre, and Stephen J. Cannell, who used to crank out pilots for series just like CASTLE over breakfast. 

But creator Andrew Marlowe left nothing to chance with this one, knowing full well that no matter how great a character is, he's nothing without a good backstory and some fascinating support players. Here these come in the form of Rick Castle's teenage daughter, Alexis (Molly C. Quinn), whom of course is the real 'adult' in their relationship - probably her way of rebelling against her lovable father who nevertheless lives the lifestyle of a guy half his age, and their temporary roommate who also happens to be his mother, former stage and screen star Martha Rodgers (Susan Sullivan in a turn that makes Shirley MacLaine in POSTCARDS FROM THE EDGE look like a dowdy matron). Once you meet Martha, suddenly Rick's personality makes perfect sense. 

As with any new series, this one will take some time to really settle into the groove it needs to capture a wider audience, but with the growing ease of the push-and-pull relationship between Fillion and Katic's characters, it could very well become the next "MOONLIGHTING" or "REMINGTON STEELE"...which wouldn't be a bad thing. Crime procedurals have been missing that fun element of late, and CASTLE could very well bring it back, without having to resort to a less-successful springboard of surrealism to build from (sorry, LIFE ON MARS).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":153101,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-03-09","keywords":"female detective,new york city,homicide investigation,novelist,crime writer","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277213/","name":"Nathan Fillion"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065664/","name":"Stana Katic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0838360/","name":"Susan Sullivan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097246/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163896/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209226/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549256/","name":"Andrew W. IMDb data; ttnr: 1219024, Title: Castle, --- Description: Castle: Created by Andrew W. Marlowe. With Nathan Fillion, Stana Katic, Susan Sullivan, Jon Huertas. After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1219024/","name":"Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM2NjU0ODU0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAwMzg5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1219024/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"cchase","dateCreated":"2009-03-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fillion is "King" Of This CASTLE...","reviewBody":"Oh, yeah, we've seen this one before....Irresistible-force-meets-immovable object. Opposites attract. Oil and water. Fire and ice...you know the drill. The problem is that when you have a pairing that mixes snappy patter and grudgingly mutual admiration with just a touch of sexual tension, the recipe is only going to be as good as the charisma of the two leads involved, whether it's a sitcom, dramedy or police procedural. 

CASTLE wants to be a mix of all three, and fortunately one of the most valuable weapons in its arsenal is the rakish charm of its featured lead actor, former FIREFLY star Nathan Fillion. I can count the number of actors on one hand who can pull off the "charming rascal" vibe in a way that never gets old, and Nathan can do those guys in his sleep. (And probably has.)

But he also knows how to modulate them as the occasion warrants, and where in his former role as Captain Mal Reynolds he could definitely play the bad-ass card when needed, here as womanizing bad-boy, party animal and bestselling novelist Rick Castle, he's a whole lot less serious. Bored with the cop character who has been his bread-and-butter for a string of chart-busting crime thrillers, Rick has decided in his latest tome to blow his hero's brains out, thus making a continuance of the series a little difficult to say the least. It wouldn't be a problem if the laid-back Lothario weren't suddenly faced with a major case of writer's block. But inspiration is coming in the most fortuitous if unlikely of ways. 

A serial killer has decided to rehash some of the more gruesome deaths from Castle's earlier novels, and it's up to the very attractive (of course!) and no-nonsense detective Kate Beckett (newcomer Stana Katic) to crack the case...which of course will require the assistance of a certain writer of whose books Detective Beckett is a closet fan. But a fan of smart-alecky guys who like to make very unsubtle passes at her? Not so much. Let the games and one-upmanship begin!

At first blush, you could easily accuse CASTLE of trying too hard, especially since matched with the seasoned experience of Fillion, the jury was out on Katic's ability to keep up with him in the first few episodes (at least it was for me.) And to enhance its credibility, the pilot even threw in some heavy hitters in guest cameos - James Patterson, no stranger himself to the crime fiction genre, and Stephen J. Cannell, who used to crank out pilots for series just like CASTLE over breakfast. 

But creator Andrew Marlowe left nothing to chance with this one, knowing full well that no matter how great a character is, he's nothing without a good backstory and some fascinating support players. Here these come in the form of Rick Castle's teenage daughter, Alexis (Molly C. Quinn), whom of course is the real 'adult' in their relationship - probably her way of rebelling against her lovable father who nevertheless lives the lifestyle of a guy half his age, and their temporary roommate who also happens to be his mother, former stage and screen star Martha Rodgers (Susan Sullivan in a turn that makes Shirley MacLaine in POSTCARDS FROM THE EDGE look like a dowdy matron). Once you meet Martha, suddenly Rick's personality makes perfect sense. 

As with any new series, this one will take some time to really settle into the groove it needs to capture a wider audience, but with the growing ease of the push-and-pull relationship between Fillion and Katic's characters, it could very well become the next "MOONLIGHTING" or "REMINGTON STEELE"...which wouldn't be a bad thing. Crime procedurals have been missing that fun element of late, and CASTLE could very well bring it back, without having to resort to a less-successful springboard of surrealism to build from (sorry, LIFE ON MARS).","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":153101,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-03-09","keywords":"female detective,new york city,homicide investigation,novelist,crime writer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277213/","name":"Nathan Fillion","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065664/","name":"Stana Katic","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0838360/","name":"Susan Sullivan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097246/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163896/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209226/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549256/","name":"Andrew W. Marlowe"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Castle: The Complete Fifth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651252761","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjQ4YmRiYmMtMWZkZi00ZDA4LTgzZWItOTgxYjExYjI5NDRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjQ4YmRiYmMtMWZkZi00ZDA4LTgzZWItOTgxYjExYjI5NDRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT 1A"</script><metacontent="
